title: The Mist
author: Stephen King
bookDescription: The small town of Brigton, Maine is shrouded in a dense mist that conceals otherwordly creatures.

title: A Random Walk Down Wall Street: The Time-Tested Strategy for Successful Investing
author: Burton G. Malkiel
bookDescription: A book on the subject of stock markets which popularized the random walk hypothesis.

author: George Orwell
bookDescription: Great Britain, now known as Airstrip One, has become a province of the totalitarian superstate Oceania, which is led by Big Brother, a dictatorial leader supported by an intense cult of personality manufactured by the Party's Thought Police.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
bookDescription: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the spice melange, a drug capable of extending life and enhancing consciousness.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
bookDescription: A Brief History of Time plunges into the exotic realms of black holes and quarks, of antimatter and arrows of time, of the big bang and a bigger God-where the possibilities are wondrous and unexpected.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bookDescription: The story of a mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when The New York Times noted gine was the national drink and sex the national obsession.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
bookDescription: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it.

title: The Lord Of The Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
bookDescription: The Lord of the Rings tells of the great quest undertaken by Frodo and the Fellowship of the Ring: Gandalf the Wizard; the hobbits Merry, Pippin, and Sam; Gimli the Dwarf; Legolas the Elf; Boromir of Gondor; and a tall, mysterious stranger called Strider.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
bookDescription: The story follows the flamboyant Brett and the hapless Jake as they journey from the wild nightlife of 1920s Paris to the brutal bullfighting rings of Spain with a motley group of expatriates.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
bookDescription: He describes growing up in a Black community in the South, attending a Black college from which he is expelled, moving to New York and becoming the chief spokesman of the Harlem branch of the Brotherhood, before retreating amid violence and confusion.
